name: A1 – Cash‑strained Hawker Stall Owner
decision_statement: for a startup company in f&b – hawker stall, This small hawker stall is struggling with cash flow due to lack of robust tracking and outdated SOPs. Despite reasonable monthly revenue of RM 35k, they often face shortage of funds leading to unstable operations.
sample_advisor_reply: First, focus on milestone "A1: Map the steps". This involves understanding and documenting your current operations. This will help identify areas of inefficiency and delay. Once you have a clear picture, move to "A2: Fix the top 2 delays". Use the map you've created to pinpoint and address these issues. Your success metric of on-time delivery ≥ 95% will be directly impacted by this. After these, implement "A3: Daily checklist and handover" to ensure smooth daily operations.

name: B1 – VC-backed SaaS Startup Founder
decision_statement: for a startup company in b2b saas, Your business is in a precarious position with a high burn rate and limited cash flow, despite having no formal debt. The lack of clear go-to-market focus and visibility into unit economics is adding to the uncertainty.
success_metric: Net operating cash flow positive within 6–12 months
sample_advisor_reply: Given your situation, the first focus should be on achieving the "13 week cash forecast" milestone. This will provide a clear picture of your financial health and cash flow situation. Simultaneously, begin working on the "Expense reset and burn target" milestone. This will help identify areas of potential cost savings, which is crucial in your current position. name: B2 – E‑commerce Brand Founder

The compa
sample_advisor_reply: Given the must-do milestones and your current situation, you should first focus on "Map the steps." This involves documenting all critical processes in your operations. Understanding the flow of your operations will help identify inefficiencies, overordering, and frequent stockouts. Once this is done, you can move to "Fix the top 2 delays," which will likely emerge from the process mapping. Remember, the ultimate goal is to improve your on-time delivery to >= 95%.

name: B3 – Multi-outlet Restaurant Group Owner
decision_statement: for a startup company in f&b – multi-outlet, The primary issue for the business is the lack of standardization among outlets leading to inconsistent performance and high wastage. A lack of transparent reporting exacerbates this issue.
sample_advisor_reply: Your first focus should be on the milestone "Map the steps." Meet with outlet heads to understand the current processes and areas of concern. This will help you to identify the steps in your operations that need standardization and where the top delays might be. Once you have a clear map of the steps, you can start drafting standardized operating procedures. Remember, the goal is to improve on-time delivery to ≥ 95% and reduce defect rate by 20% in 60 days.

name: C1 – Logistics SME Owner
decision_statement: for a startup company in logistics – last mile, The logistics company is experiencing high driver turnover, missed deliveries, and customer complaints due to a lack of process standardization and route planning system. This scenario is critically impacting reliability and customer satisfaction.
sample_advisor_reply: Your first focus should be on conducting a bottleneck analysis (milestone B1). This will help you identify the key areas causing delays in your delivery process. Simultaneously, start the selection process for suitable route planning system options. These actions will set the foundation for the next steps, which include developing standard operating procedures (SOPs) and implementing quality checks at the source.

name: C2 – Clinic Network Founder
decision_statement: for a startup company in healthcare – clinic network, The client operates a network of three healthcare clinics suffering from inconsistent processes, undermining patient experience. Inefficiencies stem from lack of standard SOPs, system adoption and ad-hoc training.
sample_advisor_reply: Your first focus should be on the "Bottleneck analysis" milestone. This will help you understand where the main inefficiencies lie in your current processes across all clinics. Once you've identified the bottlenecks, you can then move on to the "SOPs for key step" milestone, where you'll standardize the procedures to address these inefficiencies. Remember, it's crucial to involve your staff in this process to ensure the SOPs are practical and effective.

name: D2 – Newly Registered Sole Proprietor

sample_advisor_reply: Given the milestones and metrics in your Execution Plan, the first focus should be on "Map the steps". This involves defining your bakery's operational processes in detail. It's critical to understand where potential bottlenecks or inefficiencies might be causing delays. This will also help in creating a daily checklist later. Simultaneously, start working on separating your business and personal finances by opening a separate business account. This will help in better financial discipline and a
emerging_decision: The home bakery is experiencing challenges with basic financial discipline, ad-hoc pricing, and process standardization.
